alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 08 at 9:47AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...STORM FORCE LOWS FOR WEDNESDAY AND FRIDAY... A strong low over the Gulf of Alaska is bringing a storm force front to the panhandle. Winds have increased along the outer coast and then inner channels with gusts ranging from 45 to 55 mph. Most places look to see their strongest winds during afternoon and into the overnight hours Wednesday into Thursday. Winds behind the front are expected to decrease after the front moves through but post frontal winds are expected to be 20 to 30 mph before further decreasing on Thursday. River rises are expected with this first system moving through as temperatures are expected to warm. Snow levels are also expected to rise with the warming temperatures so some snow melting will be likely during this event. River flooding is not expected at this time as rivers are running lower due to the colder temperatures allowing precipitation to fall as snow at elevation. After the storm exits the area on Thursday, we will see a brief break for Southeast Alaska before another system moves into the during the overnight hours Thursday night into the morning on Friday. Forecast guidance for this second system continues to show strong winds along the front moving across the panhandle through the day on Friday starting during the morning hours. Right now, winds are expected to be 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. This is an evolving and changing situation. Stay tuned to the National Weather Service for updates at weather.gov/Juneau.
